title: %hp runes should be buffed
body:
#reposted, no comments on op

If you rack the quints and seals for %health they equl +9% max health.
At lv 1 with like 600 hp that equals 54. So you would start off with about 2/3 of what you'd get with only flat health seals, which would leave quints open for whatever. Of course it would scale better into the late game, but it is definitely nothing much.
with 3000 hp you'd get a bonus 270 HP. You could have just went hp/lv seals for the 216 health at lv 18 and you'd have your quints open for whatever.
I think the %health runes could use a buff. No one ever uses them for a reason, they are far too weak. I realized this messing with runes for a support page (nautilus).
I think boosting seals from 0.5% -> 0.75% and quints from 1.5% -> 2.25% would still be healthy, and definitely add a reason to consider using the runes. That would total it to 13.5% from 9%.
That means at lv 1 with 600 hp you'd get a bonus of 81 health. slightly over what you would get with flat health seals. However lets not forget you are also using your quints here. So it balances out.
with 3000 hp you'd get a bonus of 405 hp. If you are going for a very high HP build like 4000 hp that'd get you a bonus 540 hp. Even then, especially for supports it'd be a tough choice to sacrifice 4*3=12 armor from quints alone for 6.75% max health boost. It is a weaker start.
I just think we have some runes in the shadow of the more mainstream stuff.

The problem is that balance isnt achieved that easily. For example, lets think about %Max Health vs Flat and Scaling Health seals:

* Flat gives you 72. 
* Scaling gives 12 at level 1, 216 at level 18. 
* % health gives 4.5% of max health. 

From that, we know:

* Scaling Health outscales Flat at level 6. 
* % max health is better than Flat at 1600 HP. (In game, this is level 9 with one health item)
* % Max Health is better than Scaling at early levels. At level 1, you need 266 base health to match. At level 2, you need 533 (I believe the lowest - excluding Kled - is Anivia, and she will hit this with Dorans). At level 3, you need 800 - a small handfull of champs will hit this with their starting items alone, but a decent amount will hit this with their starting item+Veterans scars. At level 4, you need 1066, which is practically impossible. 
* Everything aside from health stacking supertanks are better with Scaling Health at level 18 (unless you get more than 4,844 HP)

So what does it mean? % max health is the bridge between the two. Its not as strong as Flat at level 1-3, but its stronger than Scaling. Its not as strong as Scaling at 1600 HP, but its stronger than Flat. Its a neutral choice between the health options if you arent sure if youre going to survive 1-3, but want something that scales into the game. 

The problem I see is that at the end of the day, the difference between Flat and Scaling Health at level 1 is 60 HP. Thats like, at max, 2 autoattacks. There really is no need for the middleground, since the decision to pick one over the other has a minuscule impact in-game and for the first 5 minutes of the game. The problem with buffing the middleground to a point of reasonable viability is that they become so strong that both the Flat and the Scaling would be second-best. Youre basically deleting two other sets just to make 1 set viable, instead of having 2 viable sets with 1 set unviable.

Allright lets breakdown the maths.

For Quints you need 1733 hp to break even with flat hp. You need 3240 hp to break even with Hp/lvl.
For seals the breakpoints go to 1600 and 4800.

Getting them to 2.25 would bring the breakpoint at 2160 hp so they would be OP. 1.75% would be a good number with breakpoint at 2780 hp that is something tanks will def reach in late game. That way you would have flats for early tankyness, hp/lvl for bruisers and supports that dont always reach that, but would love extra hp, and last but not least %hp for tanks.

As for seals. They are way behild, only benefitial to chos mundos and afk farm sions. Just kidding, not even on them. Your suggestion brings the breakpoint to 3200 hp, pretty spot on number. What would love is flats at 12hp so at lvl 9 they break even with hp/lvl.

When competing, %health favors tanks(or whoever wants to build lots hp) because they are gonna easily reach breakpoint, while hp/lvl favors those that are not sure they gonna reach it, but need some extra hp. It gives more options.

If % was ahead when building hp and the braekpoint is low, then they would be OP for tanks and rather make hp/lvl useless 2780 and 3200 hp (close to Mogs) are good breakpoints. Seriously whats the point of getting one hp item and hp/lvl when you can get two along with %hp and get a lot more?.

Rather you would be chancing that you will get ahead versus steady gains which is how games should be you take chances and if you win you get better pay offs. while if you take a safer route you get garenteed pay offs.

Hey that is what i was suggesting. Get the breakpoints close to Warmog's. They are pretty good. If we got them any lower, %hp would be better with just a deadmans or SS+locket. Those are cases for hp/lvl. It is not only about risk, but options also.

%hp: Champs that build more than one hp item like tanks, some tank supports, bruisers or Vlad.
hp/lvl: Champs that need the extra hp but wont bother building more than one hp item. Like one hp item bruisers, mages with Rylais/RoA, some supports.
Flat hp: Someone that needs hp early. So far the breakpoints is way too low to even consider them.

There is a risk that you wont reach the breakpoint, so thats still there. But the primary use of runes is versatility not risk vs reward.

Tell that to this season where everyone one gets flat runes because its reward is greater in lane allowing you to snowball a game. And your explanation of versatility of course %hp shouldnt be better just on the first item but 3rd hp item is should be turning up better than hp/ level for %. Tank stats are the only thing tanks have going for them and there are tons of options to circumvent the effectiveness of those tank stats. 4 hp item tank shouldnt be breaking even with mages or bruisers for hp who have more damage than them and range (mages other ranged classes) and often same or more mobility and cc.
